text.div:
Properties

CodeURLTypeDescription
SpecializesCodingThe child code is a more narrow version of the concept represented by the parent code. I.e. Every child concept is also a valid parent concept. Used to allow determination of subsumption. Must be transitive, irreflexive, antisymmetric.
GeneralizesCodingInverse of Specializes. Only included as a derived relationship.
internalIdhttp://terminology.hl7.org/CodeSystem/utg-concept-properties#v3-internal-idcodeThe internal identifier for the concept in the HL7 Access database repository.
statushttp://hl7.org/fhir/concept-properties#statuscodeDesignation of a concept's state. Normally is not populated unless the state is retired..
notSelectablehttp://hl7.org/fhir/concept-properties#notSelectablebooleanIndicates that the code is abstract - only intended to be used as a selector for other concepts

This code system http://terminology.hl7.org/CodeSystem/v3-EntityNameUse defines the following codes:

LvlCodeDisplayDefinitioninternalIdstatusNot Selectable
1_NameRepresentationUse NameRepresentationUseIdentifies the different representations of a name. The representation may affect how the name is used. (E.g. use of Ideographic for formal communications.)21077activetrue
2  ABC AlphabeticAlphabetic transcription of name (Japanese: romaji)15917active
2  IDE IdeographicIdeographic representation of name (e.g., Japanese kanji, Chinese characters)15919active
2  SYL SyllabicSyllabic transcription of name (e.g., Japanese kana, Korean hangul)15918active
1ASGN assignedA name assigned to a person. Reasons some organizations assign alternate names may include not knowing the person's name, or to maintain anonymity. Some, but not necessarily all, of the name types that people call "alias" may fit into this category.21358active
1C LicenseAs recorded on a license, record, certificate, etc. (only if different from legal name)10177active
1I Indigenous/Tribale.g. Chief Red Cloud10179active
1L LegalKnown as/conventional/the one you use10176active
2  OR official registry**Definition:**The formal name as registered in an official (government) registry, but which name might not be commonly used. Particularly used in countries with a law system based on Napoleonic law.21637active
1P pseudonymA self asserted name that the person is using or has used.21321active
2  A Artist/StageIncludes writer's pseudonym, stage name, etc10178active
1R Religiouse.g. Sister Mary Francis, Brother John10180active
1SRCH searchA name intended for use in searching or matching.21363active
2  PHON phoneticA name spelled phonetically. There are a variety of phonetic spelling algorithms. This code value does not distinguish between these.*Discussion:*21364active
2  SNDX SoundexA name spelled according to the SoundEx algorithm.21365active
1_EntityNameSearchUse EntityNameSearchUse**Description:** A name intended for use in searching or matching.22618retiredtrue
1_OrganizationNameUse OrganizationNameUse21078retiredtrue
1_PersonNameUse PersonNameUseA code indicating the type of name (e.g. nickname, alias, maiden name, legal, adopted)21079retiredtrue

property.description: The child code is a more narrow version of the concept represented by the parent code.  I.e. Every child concept is also a valid parent concept.  Used to allow determination of subsumption.  Must be transitive, irreflexive, antisymmetric.
Inverse of Specializes.  Only included as a derived relationship.
The internal identifier for the concept in the HL7 Access database repository.
Designation of a concept's state.  Normally is not populated unless the state is retired..
Indicates that the code is abstract - only intended to be used as a selector for other concepts

concept.definition: Identifies the different representations of a name. The representation may affect how the name is used. (E.g. use of Ideographic for formal communications.)
Ideographic representation of name (e.g., Japanese kanji, Chinese characters)
Syllabic transcription of name (e.g., Japanese kana, Korean hangul)

A name assigned to a person. Reasons some organizations assign alternate names may include not knowing the person's name, or to maintain anonymity. Some, but not necessarily all, of the name types that people call "alias" may fit into this category.
As recorded on a license, record, certificate, etc. (only if different from legal name)
**Definition:**The formal name as registered in an official (government) registry, but which name might not be commonly used. Particularly used in countries with a law system based on Napoleonic law.
A self asserted name that the person is using or has used.
Includes writer's pseudonym, stage name, etc
e.g. Sister Mary Francis, Brother John
A name intended for use in searching or matching.

A name spelled phonetically.

There are a variety of phonetic spelling algorithms. This code value does not distinguish between these.*Discussion:*
A name spelled according to the SoundEx algorithm.
**Description:** A name intended for use in searching or matching.
A code indicating the type of name (e.g. nickname, alias, maiden name, legal, adopted)
